title: Skyline Drive Status
description: Skyline Drive is closed from Loft Mountain (79.5) to Rockfish Gap (mile 105) for aerial limestone treatment. Click "more" for details and other temporary area closures.

title: Delayed Opening Due to Snow and Ice
description: Tuesday, February 17, 2026 The park and roads will open at 11 am. The Visitor and Research Center opens at noon. If a park-wide closure is required, notification will appear around 10 am. Colorado traction laws will be in effect. Drive cautiously, plows will still be working.

title: Paradise Road Status: Gate closed at Longmire, projected to open tomorrow
description: 02/17/2026 The road is open to Longmire. All vehicles, including 4WD and AWD, must carry tire chains and be ready to use them. The gate at Longmire to Paradise is closed to support public safety and is projected to open, conditions permitting, tomorrow, Wednesday 02/18/2026

title: Newton B. Drury Scenic Parkway Closure
description: Due to the incoming storm system, the Parkway is closed until later this week. Access to the Prairie Creek Visitor Center and Elk Prairie Campground will not be affected. Use Exit 753 to reach Prairie Creek Visitor Center.

title: Road to Rim Village will CLOSE at 4:30 PM Today
description: The road from Park Headquarters to Rim Village will CLOSE at 4:30 PM today due to the incoming snowstorm. Once that happens, no view of the lake is accessible by vehicle at this time. Please use caution if driving in the park. All Oregon Chain Laws apply.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Road from HQ to Rim Village Remains CLOSED.', 'id': 'A04AED55-0E2F-474B-96DD-C76EBDC1BEBD', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/crla/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Hurricane Ridge Road Status, Tuesday 2/17 - Thursday 2/19
description: During the winter season the Hurricane Ridge Road remains closed during weekdays. The road is expected to reopen on Friday 2/20 at 9am, although significant snow could delay this opening.

title: Tioga Road (Hwy 120 through the park) and Glacier Point Road are closed
description: Tioga Road (continuation of Highway 120 through the park), Glacier Point Road beyond Badger Pass, and Mariposa Grove Road are closed for the season due to snow. Snow is possible on other roads; be prepared for tire chain requirements and other road closures. Call 209/372-0200 (then 1, 1) to check road conditions.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Tioga and Glacier Point Roads winter closure', 'id': 'E5355262-0BAB-4F46-B7C0-220B97385438', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/yose/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Big Oak Flat Road is temporarily closed due to snow
description: Big Oak Flat Road (continuation of Hwy 120 toward Yosemite Valley from the west) is temporarily closed from Big Oak Flat Entrance to Foresta junction due to snow. Highway 140/El Portal Road is the alternate route. Call 209/372-0200 (then 1, 1) for updates.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Big Oak Flat Road temporary snow closure', 'id': 'C99E98BD-745E-4B7C-BB54-D70F70C808EA', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/yose/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: All But 6 Miles of Generals Highway Temporarily Closed Due to Winter Storm
description: Due to heavy snow from an ongoing winter storm, Generals Highway is temporarily closed north of Hospital Rock. This means only the southern six miles near the town of Three Rivers is open. The U.S. Forest Service Quail Flat Winter Trailhead and Wolverton Snowplay Area are not accessible during the closure. Sections of the highway will reopen when road crews are able to clear the roadway.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Temporary Closure of Much of Generals Highway Due to Winter Storm Impacts', 'id': 'D41873A5-E2D2-4F37-8F26-3B4B2DB0CF4F', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/seki/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Temporary Meyers Beach Parking Lot and Access Road Closure
description: Meyers Beach parking lot and Meyers Beach access road are temporarily closed to protect visitor safety and support incident management.

title: Winter storm forecast: carry tire chains and be prepared for road closures
description: Tire chain requirements and some road closures are likely starting Monday, February 16, due to a forecast of heavy snow. Call 209/372-0200 (then 1, 1) for current road status within Yosemite National Park.

title: Cades Cove Loop Road closures February 23-27
description: Cades Cove Loop Road will be closed to all users February 23-27 for hazard tree removal. The road will reopen at 12 PM on Friday and remain open through the weekend during regular hours (sunrise to sunset).

title: Clara Barton NHS to Remain Closed Through February 17 2026
description: George Washington Memorial Parkway, including Clara Barton NHS, and other park areas and facilities will remain closed through February 17 due to winter weather impacts. Click on "More" below for details on specific closures. Areas will reopen as soon as conditions are safe. For the latest updates, visitors should check www.nps.gov/gwmp and GWMP social media. Next update expected: February 17

title: Inclement Weather Closure
description: Closure due to hazardous road conditions due to weather conditions. Recreation is authorized in sections closed for winter weather only.

title: Road to the Trailhead Parking Lot is Closed to Vehicles for the Season
description: The road leading to the trailhead parking lot at the Big Hole National Battlefield is closed to vehicles for the season but remains open for use by snowshoers & cross-country skiers. The road to the visitor center remains open to vehicles year-round.

title: 12/12/2025 Update - Parkway and Campground closed from MP 181-204.
description: The parkway is closed to all traffic from MP 181-204. The section of the parkway, including the Jeff Busby Campground and day use area, has been closed since June 9, 2025, to allow for the removal and replacement of failed pavement and culverts. While the project was initially expected to be completed by the end of summer, unforeseen site conditions and weather delays have extended the timeline. A definitive reopening date is not available at this time. Construction will continue into 2026.

title: State Route 148 Closed Through Cedar Breaks National Monument
description: State Route 148 through Cedar Breaks National Monument is now closed for its routine winter season. Plan alternate routes and check back for updates. Visit the Utah Department of Transportation website for more route information: www.udottraffic.utah.gov

title: Invasive Vegetation Removal
description: Watch for crews treating invasive plants along Snake Bight Trail, Rowdy Bend Road, and other Flamingo areas. Approved herbicides are being used. Stay alert for workers, equipment, and posted signs.

title: Roadwork Along Lakeshore Drive at the Alfred Smith Water Treatment Plant
description: Starting February 9th, 2026, roadwork will begin on the east shoulder of Lakeshore Drive between the water treatment plant and the Lake Mead Fish Hatchery for the installation of a pipeline. Flaggers will be present during the project, but only minimal traffic delays are anticipated at times that traffic is restricted to one lane. The project is expected to be completed in a few months.

title: Playalinda District will reopen to the public on Friday February 6
description: Playalinda District operating hours - 8:00 a.m.- 5:00 p.m.  (Apollo is still 6:00 a.m.-6:00 p.m.) All inbound and outbound vistas will remain closed for security purposes. Parking areas 1-3 will remain closed for security purposes. The beach at parking area 4 and south to the NPS/KSC boundary will remain closed to the public.

title: Hains Point Closed Until Further Notice
description: Ohio Drive is closed until further notice from East Potomac Golf Links to Hains Point and back due to snow. We apologize for any inconvenience.

title: South Shore Quinault Road Washed Out Beyond Park Boundary
description: South Shore Road – which is maintained by Jefferson County – is closed due to a major wash-out. For more information, visit the Jefferson County website.

title: Access to Bluestone NSR through Bluestone State Park is closed
description: Due to road damage, the road to access Bluestone National Scenic River through Bluestone State Park is closed. The road will remain completely closed as repairs are made. It is expected to reopen in late April or early May.

title: NPS 300 Road Conditions
description: NPS 300 to Big Tubes contains deep, muddy ruts. A high clearance, four-wheel-drive vehicle is required to attempt this road. Conditions will deteriorate as snow melts.

title: Trail Closure at Scott’s Run Nature Preserve (McLean, Virginia)
description: Scott’s Run Nature Preserve in McLean, Virginia will close, beginning February 16th, for an urgent sewer project to renew and rehabilitate the Scott's Run Siphon wastewater facility. All trails and parking lots in the park are closed for approximately three months.

title: Vehicle Weight Limit at Kenilworth Aquatic Gardens Entrance
description: Due to structural conditions at the driveway entrance, access to the Kenilworth Aquatic Gardens main entrance and parking lot is limited to vehicles with a gross vehicle weight rating (GVWR) of 16,000 pounds or less.

title: Replace Bocce Ball Court Retaining Wall
description: Project work begins on Monday, February 9 to replace the bocce ball 50-foot retaining wall in order to improve existing infrastructure and enhance visitor safety. Several parking spots on lower Van Ness will be fenced off and the bocce ball court will not be accessible for the duration of the project, slated through August 2026. Please be aware of machinery, work, and signs.
park: San Francisco Maritime National Historical Park

title: West and East Border Roads closed for public safety
description: South Puerto Blanco Drive remains open. All border roads remain closed (the dirt roads directly along the border and all crossover roads leading from South Puerto Blanco Drive to the border) to all public vehicle and pedestrian traffic for public safety.

title: Temporary closure of portions of the Carter Barron parking lot
description: The south and southwest sections of the parking lot at the Carter Barron Amphitheater (US Reservation 339) are temporarily closed to allow the safe operation of District of Columbia snow storage activities as a result of Winter Storm Fern. See the Record of Determination for more information.

title: Drakes Beach Road open 10 am to 5 pm to better protect elephant seal pups.
description: Alert 1, Severity closure, Drakes Beach Road now only open 10 am to 5 pm to better protect elephant seal pups. Northern elephant seals have returned to Drakes Beach and given birth close to beach access points. To better protect the pups during this important time, the parking lot will only be open when park staff and volunteers are present, every day from 10:00 am to 5:00 pm. The beach itself will remain closed, but seals are viewable from the parking lot and Ken Patrick Visitor Center area during these ho

title: Pavement Project- Playalinda District
description: The Playalinda Beach District continues a Federal Highways pavement preservation project that started on Sept. 22nd, 2025. Visitors to the seashore could expect limited access to some parking areas and roadways to include the vistas.

title: Winter Closures
description: The following areas are closed for the winter season: [1] South Rim Road beyond the visitor center. [2] All North Rim facilities and vehicle access. North Rim Road is closed to vehicles and gated at the park boundary. [3] East Portal Road--the road and its closure are managed by the U.S. Bureau of Reclamation. Pedestrians and bicycles are currently allowed on closed roads, conditions permitting. Use caution.
park: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park

title: East Portal Road Closed
description: The East Portal Road is closed for the winter season.

title: Hopeton Earthworks Closed for Construction Until May 2026
description: Hopeton Earthworks, located at 990 Hopetown Rd. Chillicothe, OH 45601, is closed for construction until May 2026. Parking lot improvements and construction activity will block safe access to cars and foot traffic at the trail heads. Call the park at 740-774-1126 for more information or visit the park's Mound City Group Visitor Center at 16062 State Route 104, Chillicothe, OH 45601.

title: State Route 20 Closed MP112
description: State Route 20 is closed at milepost 112 limiting access into the park. Additional closures may exist along SR20. For more information click the link to the WSDOT real time map.

title: Backcountry vehicle route closed for winter season
description: Vehicular access to Valles Caldera's backcountry is currently closed for the 2025-2026 winter season. During the off-season, the route will remain open to pedestrians, equestrians, cyclists, skiers, and snowshoers. The route is scheduled to reopen to vehicular traffic on May 15, 2026.

title: Intermittent Closure of Park Loop Trailhead parking
description: From January 15 through March 5 there may be intermittent closures of the Park Loop Trail parking lot at Fayetteville Town Park as crews are working on a project to expand parking in that location.
park: New River Gorge National Park and Preserve

title: Smith Point Bridge Following Single Lane Traffic Pattern
description: Visitors driving to access the Otis Pike Wilderness and Smith Point County Park should be aware that the Smith Point Bridge is open currently following a single lane traffic pattern. There is a 15 ton vehicle weight limit.

title: Seasonal road closures
description: The following roads are closed for the season: Kuwohi Road, Roaring Fork Motor Nature Trail, Little Greenbrier Road, Heintooga Ridge Road, Forge Creek Road, Parson Branch Road, and Rich Mountain Road.

title: Ongoing Road Projects and Helene Recovery
description: Parkway areas closed for ongoing road maintenance, construction, and Helene recovery projects.

title: Winter Road Closures
description: The Wheeler Peak Scenic Drive is closed for the season at Upper Lehman Creek Campground (mile 3). Snake Creek Road and Strawberry Creek Road are closed for the season at the park boundary. Baker Creek Road is closed at Grey Cliffs Campground. Click "more" for current road and campground closures.

title: Some roads and campgrounds closed
description: Several park roads and campgrounds are closed due to flash flooding on 12/24, 1/1 & 1/3. Some open roads have damaged shoulders and debris. Drive with caution. Click "more" and scroll down for detailed information.

title: Tyler Bend Area Closures
description: Starting on January 20, 2026, the Tyler Bend Pavilion, Pavilion Parking Area, and Lower Launch river access will be closed to the public due to a construction project. The area is expected to open no later than March 31, 2026.

title: Kennesaw Mountain Road Closed to Private Vehicles and Cyclists
description: Starting January 5th, 2026, the road to the top of Kennesaw Mountain will be closed to private vehicles and cyclists due to construction and painting. The park's Visitor Center is still accessible. This work is in preparation for the upcoming Safety Improvement Project. For updates, continue to check park's website.

title: A Few Small Roads Closed Due to Roadway Damage and/or Repair Work
description: These roads are closed due to roadway damage during past storm events and/or repairs to roadway damage: Middle Fork Rd, Redwood Canyon Rd, South Fork Rd, Crystal Cave Rd
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Road Closures Related to Road Damage From and/or Repairs Of Past Storm Events', 'id': 'EF614A2C-8A9A-4188-AED2-768723DD55A3', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/seki/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Generals Highway Closed For the Season Between Grant Grove and Giant Forest
description: Generals Highway is closed between Lodgepole Village and Montecito Lodge for the winter season. It is not possible to drive between Grant Grove/General Grant Tree in Kings Canyon National Park and Giant Forest and General Sherman Tree in Sequoia National Park. The closed section usually opens in late March, depending on snow conditions.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Generals Highway Seasonal Closure Between Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks', 'id': '020DE4D9-0335-4AAA-91C4-E88B306B4230', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/seki/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Bridge Closure on FM 2610
description: The bridge over Menard Creek on Farm to Market Road (FM) 2610 is closed for construction. Birdwatchers Trail is open and accessible from the south through Romayor.

title: Winter Seasonal Road Closure
description: The Scenic Drive past the visitor center is closed to vehicles for the winter season. When free of snow, the Scenic Drive is available for pedestrian use, including walking and biking. After it is snow-covered, skiing, snowshoeing, and walking are allowed. The visitor center is accessible and open 8:00 am-4:30 pm Monday through Saturday and closed seasonally on Sundays and federal holidays.

title: Construction work at entrance to Visitor Center parking lot
description: Construction work at the entrance to the Visitor Center parking lot will cause single-lane road closures from January through March. Please use caution and follow signage or directions from workers.

title: Limited Parking and Traffic Delays in Summit District
description: Beginning Monday, January 12, 2026 Haleakalā Visitor Center (summit district) parking lot will have limited parking due to a water infrastructure project. Expect traffic delays. The project will last several months.

title: Winter Season Closures
description: The Wall Street side of the Navajo Loop Trail is closed. The Bryce Connector Trail (between Bryce Point and Peekaboo Loop) is closed. The roads to Paria View and Fairyland Point are closed to vehicles.

title: Lassen National Park Highway Closed for Winter
description: The main park road (Hwy 89) is closed at Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center (southwest entrance) and Loomis Plaza (northwest entrance) for the snow season. The road will not reopen until late spring or early summer. Please use caution if driving to the park and check weather forecasts.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Lassen National Park Highway Closed for Winter', 'id': '87E8F978-1454-4AA0-8D4F-82C6EC05ED9B', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/lavo/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Going-to-the-Sun Road Seasonal Closure
description: Going-to-the-Sun Road is now closed for the season at Lake McDonald Lodge on the west side of the park. On the east side, the closure is located 1.5 miles west of the St. Mary Visitor Center. Travel on open sections of the road may change at any time due to winter weather conditions. Visitors should check road conditions before their arrival and be prepared for winter weather.

title: Limited Access to Apollo District Parking Lots 2 and 3
description: Please be advised that parking areas #2 and #3 of Apollo Beach district (New Smyrna Beach) will be closed beginning January 5, 2026. These boardwalks are set for demolition and replacement. These areas will be closed to public access during construction. For your safety, please respect all posted closures and avoid entering closed areas of the seashore. Thank you for your patience and cooperation.

title: Winter Seasonal Road Closures
description: The following roads are closed for the winter season or due to current snow conditions: Mineral King Rd, Highway 180 between Grant Grove and Cedar Grove, Main Sherman Tree Parking, Crescent Meadow and Moro Rock Roads, and Panoramic Point Road.

title: Park Headquarters Road closed
description: Park Headquarters Road is closed due to rehabilitation work on the Sugarlands water and wastewater systems.

title: Roads to Butte Lake, Juniper Lake, and Warner Valley Closed for Winter
description: Roads to Butte Lake, Juniper Lake, and Warner Valley areas are closed to vehicle access due to snow. Roads leading to Juniper Lake and Warner Valley sustained significant damage outside of the park with no ETA for repair. *Note: snow machine use is prohibited within the boundaries of Lassen Volcanic National Park.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Roads to Butte Lake, Juniper Lake, and Warner Valley Closed for Winter', 'id': '5C320303-369F-42C5-B441-CED863E56495', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/lavo/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: South Parking Lot of Greenbelt Park Closed to Vehicles until March 31, 2026
description: The south parking lot of Greenbelt Park will be closed to vehicle access until March 31, 2026, at 11:59 p.m. The area will remain available to pedestrians.

title: Winter Weather Information – Updates Posted as Needed
description: During winter snow advisories or warnings, park grounds and parking lots can become inaccessible, resulting in delayed openings or temporary closures until staff can safely clear snow. Tours could be canceled, and restrooms may be locked until conditions improve. Winter conditions at the falls can create icy surfaces at Overlook and Mary Ellen Kramer Parks, which can also lead to temporary closures. If open, visitors are advised to use extreme caution. Click “More” to view a winter safety video.
park: Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park

title: Pierce Stocking Scenic Drive closed for annual winter/spring season
description: The Pierce Stocking Scenic Drive is closed to vehicles for the annual winter and spring closure. The drive is open for hiking and walk-in recreation during the vehicle closure.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Pierce Stocking Scenic Drive annual winter/spring road closure', 'id': 'B497521F-816F-4622-9333-7EAAC75D0CA8', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/slbe/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Temporary closures possible if parking is unavailable
description: If parking lots are full, there is a temporary closure of the park entrance at Georgetown Pike & Old Dominion Dr. Park re-opens when space is available. No waiting, no street parking. Updates at Great Falls Park Facebook page.

title: Routine Winter Service Levels in Effect
description: Roads and areas of the park may be closed or inaccessible during the winter, Please check the park's current conditions page to learn more.
park: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area

title: Fayette Station Road closure Jan 6 thru winter
description: The WV DOH will be closing the Tunny Hunsaker Bridge on Fayette Station Road from January 12 through the winter for bridge deck replacement. The road will be closed from Taeys Landing on the north side to the end of the one-way traffic on the south side.
park: New River Gorge National Park and Preserve

title: Eastern Front Tour Road south of Route 36 - Closed
description: The Eastern Front Tour Road south of Route 36 is closed to all vehicles due to a sinkhole near Harrison Creek (stop 4). Walkers and bicyclist are allowed to use the road. Use caution in the Harrison Creek area.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Eastern Front Tour Road south of Route 36 - Closed', 'id': 'FF05DA0E-813F-450F-880A-A818832377D3', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/pete/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Reef Ride Bike Days 2026
description: For this special event in honor of National Public Lands Day, the Scenic Drive will be closed to motor vehicles for part of the day on Saturday, September 19 and Saturday, September 26, 2026. The road will be closed to vehicles from sunrise to 3 pm to allow for bicycles and pedestrians to enjoy the road at a more leisurely pace. The main road through the park (UT highway 24) - will remain open and unaffected by this closure.

title: Closure Area by Grange
description: Contractors have continued working on repairs to the Grange house. To complete needed work safely we are altering vehicle and pedestrian traffic from the road by the Grange. The closure area includes the entire Grange yard, road through that area, and part of the bend where the water hydrant is. The closure DOES NOT include the road that goes on the west side of the Grange down to the Grange dock. Please use alternate routes until this work is completed. Do not drive in the grass on the historic landscapes

title: Cascade River Road Winter Closure
description: Cascade River Road is closed to vehicles at milepost 21 (Johnson Cabin) two miles before the trailhead. Foot and bicycle traffic is permitted beyond the gate.

title: Most Park Roads Not Maintained for Winter
description: Sand Point Road is the only park road maintained in winter. Miners Castle Road, Chapel Road, Beaver Road, and H-58 between Grand Marais and Adam's Trail are not maintained.

title: SR 165 Carbon River/Fairfax Bridge is closed: no access to Carbon River or Mowich Lake.
description: There is NO public access to Carbon River & Mowich Lake from SR 165. The bridge is closed to pedestrians, bicycles and vehicles and there is no alternate route.

title: Hart Mine Road Closed
description: Hart Mine Road Closed.

title: Kelly Point Road Winter Motorized Vehicle Restriction Begins November 21st.
description: Motorized vehicles are not allowed on Kelly Point Road in winter (NPS1203) without a permit. This restriction is in effect beginning Friday, November 21st, 2025.

title: Federal Holiday Closure:  Thanksgiving, Christmas, New Years Day
description: For the Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Years Day federal holidays, Capulin Volcano National Monument Visitor Center and vehicle access to the Volcano top will be closed.  The top access will be open to pedestrian and bicycle traffic; and all trails will be open for hiking.

title: Volcano Top Access Closed to Vehicles over 26 feet long and to all Trailers
description: The Volcano top access is closed to all RVs, buses, attached pull trailers, or any other vehicle over 26 feet in length due to public safety concerns and limited parking.  Trailer drop-off and RV/bus parking are available at the visitor center.

title: Winter Season Closures
description: The following regular winter season road closures are in place: Westside Road, Paradise Valley Road, Stevens Canyon Road, White River Road, Sunrise Road, State Routes 410/Chinook Pass (between Crystal Mountain Blvd. & Morse Creek) and 123/Cayuse Pass (at the park boundary).

title: Beach Access Ramp Closure
description: Beginning November 17, the Fort Matanzas beach ramp will be closed to the public for ramp and parking lot improvements as well as the construction of a new public access boardwalk to the beach. The NPS anticipates this construction will take place through May of 2026. During this time no public access by FOOT or VEHICLE is allowed. We appreciate your patience and understanding as we work to improve Fort Matanzas National Monument. This closure does NOT affect Ferry Boat operations to Fort Matanzas.

title: Loop Road and North Entrance Seasonal Closures
description: The Loop Road and North Entrance are closed to motorized vehicles until May 2026. These areas are accessible by foot, bike, ski, and snowshoe. Restrooms and campsites are accessible but not maintained in the off-season. Learn more about winter recreation and seasonal closures below.
park: Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument

title: Loop Road Closure
description: The Loop Road is currently closed to vehicles and will reopen spring 2026 when weather permits. The road is open to walking, hiking, cross-country skiing, and snowshoeing as weather permits. Please plan accordingly.
park: Craters of the Moon National Monument and Preserve

title: Big Savage Tunnel To Close for Winter
description: Somerset County will close the Big Savage Tunnel for the 2025-26 winter season on Wednesday, November 26. This seasonal closure, performed annually, protects the lining of the tunnel from freeze-thaw cycles brought on by high winds, cold temperatures, and wet, snowy conditions at high elevation. Please note that there is no detour, and local roads are narrow and treacherous. Please plan your winter excursions elsewhere on the GAP. The tunnel will reopen in late March or early April, depending on weather.

title: Winter Hours Begin on October 1, 2025: 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM
description: Little Bighorn Battlefield will be moving to our winter hours beginning October 1st. All available facilities will be open at 8:00 AM. The Tour Road, Last Stand Hill, and Reno-Benteen area will close at 3:30 PM. The contact station, bookstore, and national cemetery will close at 4:00 PM.

title: Oversized Vehicles are Unable to Park in Visitor Center Parking Lot
description: Due to construction, oversized vehicles will not be allowed to park in the visitor center parking lot due to lack of space and ability to turn-around safely. There is oversized parking along the main park road.

title: Road Open To: Mile 3 (Park Headquarters)
description: The Denali Park Road is currently open to Mile 3, Park Headquarters. Snowy conditions beyond that point prevent vehicle travel, though pedestrian travel is permitted.

title: Medano Pass Winter Season Closures in Effect
description: The Medano Pass Primitive Road is closed to through traffic for the winter season.
park: Great Sand Dunes National Park and Preserve

title: Temporary Nighttime Road Closures for Deer Management
description: From November 1, 2025 to March 31, 2026, the NPS may temporarily close select park roads between 5 pm to 4 am to conduct deer management operations. Per the Rock Creek Park Superintendent’s Compendium, trails and other park areas close at sunset.

title: Temporary Bridge on North Shore Quinault Rd Removed for Winter
description: A temporary bridge on the North Shore Quinault Road was removed for the winter on October 23, 2025. The bridge will be reinstalled next spring as conditions allow. The Graves Creek area cannot be accessed via South Shore Road due to a washout beyond the national park boundary.

title: Park Hours may Change due to Winter Storms
description: Opening delays or temporary closures due to blowing snow, accumulation, and icy roads are likely when these conditions exist. Roads will reopen when snowplows have cleared them for safe two-way travel. Before visiting, check this page for up-to-date information. Colorado Traction Law may apply, see info below. Click link for weather.

title: Intermittent Lane Closures at GW Parkway for Bridge/Pavement Preservation
description: Beginning on Monday, November 17, 2025, expect intermittent traffic impacts at GWMP. This Bridge and pavement preservation work is expected to extend into the Fall of 2026 and will make repairs to 24 GWMP bridges and over 30 paved roads and parking assets. To minimize traffic impacts, weekday lane closures on George Washington Memorial Parkway, Clara Barton Parkway, and Spout Run Parkway will NOT be allowed inbound to DC from 5:30am to 9:30am and outbound from DC from 2:30pm to 7:30pm Monday through Friday.

title: Straight Fork and the one-way section of Balsam Mountain Road closed.
description: Straight Fork and the one-way section of Balsam Mountain Road (Heintooga Round-Bottom Road) are closed.

title: Upper Fort Mason Roads and Parking Area Closures Fall 2025 - Fall 2026
description: Roads and parking areas at upper Fort Mason will have closures during utilities and seismic retrofit projects. Closures planned Fall 2025 through Fall 2026. Lots will be fenced and used as staging areas for projects occurring at Fort Mason. Signs will be posted in advance of utilities work as project progresses through each area at Fort Mason. Read signs and do not park in posted areas. Vehicles will be towed at owner's expense.

title: Most Park Roads Closed to All Vehicles
description: Most roads are closed to prepare for commercially-guided snowcoach and snowmobile travel during the winter season, which will begin December 15 (weather depending). The road between the North and Northeast entrances is the only road open year-round to regular vehicles.

title: Winter Seasonal Road Closures
description: Portions of the Teton Park Road (Taggart Lake TH to Signal Mt.), Moose-Wilson Road (Granite Canyon TH to Death Canyon Road), and other roads are closed to vehicles. Check the Grand Teton Roads page for the latest seasonal and weather related closures. When free of snow, Teton Park and Moose-Wilson Roads are available for pedestrian use, including walking and biking. After they are snow-covered: skiing, snowshoeing, and walking are allowed.

title: Cunard Road Closure
description: Cunard Road is closed through the winter due to ongoing construction. The closure is just beyond the Brooklyn Miner Trail and both the Brooklyn Miner and the Kaymoor trail remain open. The closure is expected to last until the end of March. Check back for updates.
park: New River Gorge National Park and Preserve

title: North Entrance Road and Rim Drive are CLOSED for the Season
description: The North Entrance Road and Rim Drive are now CLOSED for the season. They will not reopen until mid to late June or July 2026.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'North Entrance Road and Rim Drive are CLOSED for the Season', 'id': '3AB12B2F-7C46-4EFF-BF4B-B431F4FB2C81', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/crla/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: National Cemetery Closed to Vehicles; Open to Pedestrians
description: Due to weather related incidents, Vicksburg National Cemetery is closed to vehicular traffic, however it is open to pedestrians. Visitor can park in the adjacent USS Cairo parking lot and walk into the cemetery.

title: Louisiana Circle Closed
description: Louisiana Circle is closed to vehicles and pedestrians due to slope instability. Navy Circle is open and also provides views of the Mississippi River.

title: Access to Big South Fork’s Scenic O&W Road Blocked Due to Bridge Failure
description: Road access to O&W Road was blocked by order of the State of Tennessee Department of Transportation. Pine Creek Bridge was closed by the state because it was deemed unsafe. The closed bridge is the first bridge on O&W Road after the Toomey Road intersection. The closed bridge is outside of the boundary of the Big South Fork National River & Recreation Area.
park: Big South Fork National River and Recreation Area

title: El Calderon Trail closed for construction August 11, 2025 through May 2026
description: The El Calderon Trail and parking area are closed from August 11, 2025, through late May 2026 for a major improvement project. NPS Road 100 will remain open for local traffic only, and the Continental Divide Trail will remain open for CDT thru-hikers.

title: Illinois Memorial Closed for Restoration
description: The memorial itself is closed for restoration starting on September 16, 2025. The parking area is partially closed. Parking spaces are open to allow access to Tour Stop 2/Shirley House. Tour Stop 3/3rd Louisiana Redan is open. The Tour Road is open.

title: Dingmans Falls Trail, Road, and Access Closed for Bridge Replacement
description: Dingmans Falls site is closed for a bridge replacement project and trail rehabilitation. All traffic, including pedestrian, cyclist, and vehicle traffic, is prohibited on the road and trail during construction.
park: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area

title: Road Construction Continues on a Section of Brotherton Road in Chickamauga Battlefield
description: The Brotherton Road closure, between Alexander's Bridge and LaFayette Roads, remains in effect as rehabilitation continues. During the closure, all public traffic is prohibited from using the closed section.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Closure of a Section of Brotherton Road in Chickamauga Battlefield', 'id': '2447DCCC-35CB-487A-9E1D-ABD719B80885', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/chch/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]
park: Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park

title: Road workers on Park Road in Davis Bayou
description: Phase II of the Davis Bayou Bicycle and Pedestrian Path and road resurfacing project has begun. Visitors may encounter minor traffic delays and flaggers on Park Road.

title: Extended Mt. Auburn Street and Sparks Street Closure
description: Local road closures and detours on Mount Auburn Street and Sparks Street, and a lane closure on Memorial Drive, may affect traffic and directions to the site. Please observe posted detour and traffic change signs.
park: Longfellow House-Washington's Headquarters National Historic Site

title: Green River Ferry Temporarily Closed
description: The Green River Ferry is temporarily closed for several months while repairs are made to its navigational system and support towers which sustained extensive damage during flooding in April 2025.

title: Mainland Parking Lot Closure June 2
description: The mainland parking lot will be closed as of June 2 for rehab and improvements. For more information please see the press release.

title: Major Road Closure in Corinth, MS
description: ALERT - Major Road Closure in Corinth, Mississippi. A major bridge replacement has begun on North Polk Street in Corinth, MS, and motorists will need to seek other routes. The work is not estimated to be completed until July or August 2026.

title: Possible Delays on Old Mine Road due to Van Campens bridge repairs
description: Due to a bridge repair project over the Van Campens Brook, visitors on Old Mine Road may encounter delays over Summer 2025. The road will remain open, with single-lane traffic during working hours.
park: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area

title: Main Street Walpack Bridge Closed Until Further Notice
description: Main Street in Walpack Center is closed at the Flatbrook Bridge due to structural damage to the bridge.
park: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area

title: Parking Lot Closure
description: Due to ongoing construction, the parking lot is closed. Ample street parking can be found along Dudley Street, including the Brookline Reservoir. For accessible parking, please visit our "Contact Us" page for more information.
park: Frederick Law Olmsted National Historic Site

title: Road Closure and Fishing Pier Impact
description: The Engineer Wharf, one of two fishing piers at Fort Monroe is temporarily closed. The Finger Pier remains open. Also closed is the section of Fenwick Road between Ingalls and the East Gate of the fort. Detour signs will aid travelers around the closure.

title: North Union Avenue and Grant Circle Closed for Repairs
description: North Union Avenue and Grant Circle are closed to vehicular and pedestrian traffic for repairs. Entering these construction areas is prohibited. This work is to repair severe weather damage in 2020. The remainder of the park and tour road are open.

title: Closures Due to Flood Damage
description: Some areas of the park including Walnut Canyon Desert Drive and some trails remain closed after extensive flood damage. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open.

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures
description: Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.

title: Maurice Stephens Parking Lot Closed During Construction Project
description: The parking lot near the Maurice Stephens house, located on Rt 23 opposite from the Washington Memorial Chapel, is closed during construction and renovation work on the house. Visitors are encouraged to park in the Chapel lot for Grand Parade trail access

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures
description: Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures
description: Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.

title: River Ferry at Akers (on State Highway K) CLOSED until further notice
description: The Akers Ferry on State Highway K will not be in service until further notice.

title: South Woolum Road Closed, Alternate Route Available
description: In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. The Woolum launch and campground remain open.

title: Williams Ranch Road Closed
description: The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to unsafe conditions.

title: Park Closures
description: From time to time the missile range that surrounds the park performs military testing that may require the closure of the park or Highway 70. Please plan your visit around upcoming military tests.

title: Hawk Creek Lane Restriction at Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area
description: Due to undercutting action of Hawk Creek on the access road between the Hawk Creek campground and boat launch, the road will be reduced to one lane until further notice. Use caution while on this road.

title: Pozo Nuevo Road to Bates Well Ranch High Clearance, 4-Wheel Drive Only
description: High Clearance, 4-wheel drive is required from where Pozo Nuevo Road begins along South Puerto Blanch Drive to Bates Well Ranch area. The road is washed out in areas. Bates Well Ranch is still accessible from the north on Darby Well Road.

title: Roadwork may cause delays on US 41/Tamiami Trail
description: Current roadwork is ongoing along the park's northern boundary on US Highway 41/Tamiami Trail to raise the road for Everglades Restoration benefits. Drivers may experience up to 15-minute delays and should watch for personnel, equipment and slow downs.

title: County Line Road Closed Monday To Friday
description: County Line Road is closed during the week, from Monday through Friday. The closure will apply to all vehicular, pedestrian, and bicycle traffic. Please find an alternate route.

title: Temporary Blackland Prairie Trail Closure to Equestrians
description: Heavy rain has undermined a culvert making it unsafe for passage. Due to horse trailer parking availability, the entire section is closed to equestrians. Hikers are still able to travel from the railroad tracks to the Parkway Visitor Center.

title: Park Operations Altered Due to Pretty Rocks Landslide
description: Summer access to facilities and services in Denali remains altered due to the Pretty Rocks Landslide and the associated closure of the Park Road at Mile 43. Check here for more information on what to expect.

title: High Crowds & Park Capacity
description: High visitation may require limiting access to Bear Gulch and other parking areas in the park. If all parking lots reach capacity, incoming traffic will not pass the campground until space is available. This occurs most often between 8a and 3p on weekends

title: Santa Barbara Island Dock Closed; Landings Restricted to Adjacent Rocky Ledge
description: Santa Barbara Island is open to public access, but landings are restricted to the rocky ledge adjacent to the dock. The dock is closed and is not expected to be repaired in the near future due to the severe winter storm damage.
